Castello di Amorosa.name: Castello di Amorosa
reviews:
I was SUCH a Negative Nancy about going to this place. Thought it was going to be super generic and too touristy with mediocre wine.
Well, what a suprise when I had an awesome time!!
Our sommelier, Hassan, was fantastic. Super knowledgeable, lovable, funny. We had a great time with him. The property is beautiful, felt like I was in an episode of GoT.
The wine was delicious! We had just come from another (castle) place where we completely felt underwhelmed - not great wine, could have totally gone without. This place was awesome. Even the gift store items are super cool.
My only stink is that it's a VERY busy place with a lot of tourists. But we ended up not caring about that at all.
Plus they are dog friendly and that was a big bonus. We became members ;)
Show less

Unless you are avid wine lover, most of the time you are looking the experience rather than just the wines. And here you go at Castello. The wines are exclusive and rather expensive, but it is good. For the price I supposed you pay for the nice castle-filled photo shots as well. :) Worth going for the tour but pls book. The service is normal, can be better if have more staff dedicated to serve you and explain more abt their wines and history.
Show less

So many nooks and crannies to explore, every corner a gorgeous view or photo-worthy spot. The grounds were beautiful and fun to roam. Such a romantic setting - a South Asian couple was getting their engagement photos done and their colorful, elegant clothes looked stunning against the regal backdrop - what a great idea! The staff were friendly, but skilled at managing the crowd and flow of visitors. I highly recommend doing a tasting - the staff were friendly, charming, and knowledgeable. I bought a few wines and souvenirs, which is not typically my style, but they were all worth it. I felt so relaxed and happy here! I'd love to go back.
Show less

My wife and I love Italy. The building wasn’t as bad as I feared, and the employees were lovely. But place was totally slammed (crowded) on a Sunday. Crowds were impenetrable at the tasting room, so our $30 tickets went unused. They need to somehow limit attendance or vastly expand facilities or sell “castle only” tickets. Avoid!
Show less
Beautiful and a Site to See!

Okay; this is not your typical winery. The owner has spared no expense in creating this castle. We didn't do the tour, but walked around and enjoyed some lovely views before heading down to the wine room. A super friendly and helpful young woman assisted us in making our tasting selections. We felt quite attended to and indulged, certainly not rushed. We found a great wine that we bought several bottles of for ourselves and for gifts. This is not your usual winery but definitely a place to visit while in Napa Valley.
Show less
Even though I am not a wine fan I really enjoyed this tour. Such a unique property and experience. I even found a wine I loved (1st time for this)

Best winery around. We toured the Castle and had great wine recommendations from Jamie. He was the best and so knowledgeable. Highly recommend visiting the beautiful grounds and joining their wine club.

In Napa, we went to Castello di Amorosa, it was meant to represent a Roman castle ( I think...) and it was much like one... so there’s a courtyard, and a half fake dining room thingy ( not for dining!) There’s also a gift shop! Plenty of wine, underground in the fake castle is where you taste the wine, but you need a tour guide, ( it’s a maze down there! And I don’t think you can go down by yourself! ) They has really good chocolate and breadsticks! And in the dining room there are paintings of naked people like the one down there...
Show less

We got a bit late to take the tour. ... so we went unguided. ... but it's still amazing experience. ... The wine tasting was underground room a long with gift shop. ... The castle was amazing. ... touring around it was nice. ...

We loved our visit to the Castle! We took the guided tour led by Henri who was extremely knowledgeable and fun for our small group. The Castle was not only beautiful but authentically built to reflect the 14th and 15th centuries. The tunnels and lower levels, including the dungeon and torture chamber were very interesting too. The wine and cheese pairings were amazing, and Henri offered an opportunity to taste many reserve wines. We highly recommend this as a daylong experience.
Show less
Go on a Sunday to avoid the crowds!

My husband and I have been here many, many times (he's a wine club member). It's a beautiful place. We often take our out-of-town family members to visit the Castello. Saturdays are pretty crowded so book tours in advance or arrive early. Sundays are a great day to visit as it isn't as busy or crowded.
Show less

The person at our hotel told us not to go there, but we were glad we didn’t listen to him. It was a bit cheesy with the castle motif but the scenery is so beautiful it more than made up for it. The wines are actually getting good ratings and I would definitely go back. Great place for a tour and tasting.
Show less
Best wine we found in Napa, we went to 8 winerys. Highly recommended paying extra for tastings of the reserved wine. Castle was beautiful and so was the view. Our tour guide was spectacular!

Took the castle tour and tasting, with the chocolate add-on. Tour was very interesting, and had a fun and informative guide. The castle is definitely worth seeing! Authentic, although not old. At the end, a tasting with your tour guide. Only issue here is...the groups have 15-20 people and its very hard for one guide to service so many people. Wines are only available on site, and fairly good. All in all, recommend the stop!
Show less

This is an absolutely amazing. We toured the castle, and tasted wine that would rival any we had in Italy. We also restocked our wine collection back home as they do ship.
The grounds are impeccable to the days of castles even down to the moat and draw bridge. If you are in Napa valley you need to come see the castle and taste some very good wine, as it can't be bought any where else.
Show less

This is a must see when visiting Calistoga! We were one of the last tours of the afternoon but never felt rushed or hurried along. The guide was funny and informative -so much to see and take in . Of course the torture chamber was our children's favorite room in the castle. Paying the extra for the guided tour is well worth it.
Show less

We went to Castello di Amorosa because we love medieval tuscan castles having seen quite a few when we went to Italy. Although, it’s not a real medieval castle it has that feels of being back to Tuscany. Beautiful castle. We enjoyed the wine tasting with Hassan, of all the wine tastings we had, this was the most fun as he is very friendly and gave us insights of their wine making. Overall, this place is highly recommended!
Show less

A rich man's hobby, this castle was imported from Europe and rebuilt in the Napa Valley. The entrance fees are extraordinarily high for a short tour, capped off with wine tasting. For some impenetrable reason, the food tours were not available on our day (we wanted a bite to eat around noon when we were there). Our guide was very professional, the winery tour would be interesting for someone who had never gone on one before, and the wine tasting was generous. We found the red wines disappointing, but the whites and dessert wines excellent! You can join a wine club and some of the monthly events on the grounds are very intriguing.
Show less
The wine tour inside this castle takes you through the history of wine making through the years, ending with a wine tasting. A valuable experience.
Visit to Castillo di Amorosa during our California vacation

It was raining the whole day when we went there at Napa valley but I said to myself now or never for we have to return to Houston,Texas. My brother who had already visited the Castello told us there is a rooster as big as a dog in the castle. To my amazement, the rooster was walking right in front of us when we were entering the grounds. It was really huge but my niece who had seen the rooster before said it's bigger when the feathers are dry. I was struck by the castles beauty. Immediately we took pictures of the rooster, then the gargoyles at the gate, the drawbridge, and couldn't stop snapping the camera everywhere. It was so overwhelming and you feel like you are in a castle in a storybook come to life. The entrance fee was $35 wine tasting included and the guided tour was $45.00. We did not do the guided tour on this occasion. We explored around the castle taking pictures of every nooks, hallways, balconies, towers, giant wine kegs, wine bottles, courtyard, doors, stairs, impressive restrooms with paintings on the doors and all the areas pleasing to our eyes. We ended up in the gift shop and could not resist buying the scented soap, lotion, etc. At last the most awaited moment was the wine tasting. Our server was really nice and with a sense of humor. Explained well the wine we tasted and what food to go with it. We enjoyed so much our wine tasting experience. He was so good that the three of us ended up buying 4 bottles of grape juice and 2 bottles of wine, Sangiovese and Simpatica. On the way to the cashier I picked up a wine bottle refrigerator magnet and a bottle of grape seed oil. It was really a very wonderful and amazing experience for us even with the rain.
Show less

Fantastic place. Take the tour if you can. Real castle and fun for non drinkers in your group too. Michelle went above and beyond. Check out the futures wines. Pretty amazing stuff. Heri took great care of us too.

I recently took my fourth wine tasting trip using the Calistoga wine passport and this is one of the wineries included and my most favorite! It is a must visit! It is my favorite wine, the grounds are beautiful and the view is amazing!
Amazing place to visit and it is a must for all to go there.

We had a great guide who was able to answer our questions and was knowledgeable about the castle, history and the wine. The wine tasting with different cheeses was a big plus. It is best to have a guided tour, rather than going on a self-guided tour.
Show less

We choose to do the self guided tour for $30 and 5 tastings were included. It was beautiful but very crowded/ "touristy" even in January. This is known as the "castle" it is one of the iconic places of Napa. There are other guided tours that allows you to go into more rooms that are off limits to the general admission, but i do not feel like i missed out on anything by doing the self guided tour. Very cool and beautiful
** watch out for cops! They are everywhere on the roads**
Show less
Loved the tour of the castle and the tasting

This was our first trip to Napa Valley and my girlfriends and I visited in January. Even though it's winter, January is a wonderful time to go to Napa. There are just no crowds at all. We did the wine/cheese and castle tour for $70 and we all thought it was not overpriced. We started the tour at 10:45 and did not leave until about 2:30. Our guide, Henri, was personable and knowledgable. He went out of his way to interact with everyone in our group. We toured the lowered levels of the castle, did the torture room and then a tasting in an elegant room sitting at a dining table with cheeses and crackers. One of my girlfriends only likes sweet, white wine. Henri completely switched her wines to accommodate her. If you are a local in the area, I can see why you might skip it. But if it's your first time in Napa and you are not sure when you might get back then I would say that it's a must see winery.
Btw, the detail of the castle and it's construction is simply fascinating. I have seen many castles in Europe and you can tell that the owner put so much heart and passion into the construction of this beautiful building. I would definitely recommend!
Show less
Great stop on our couples weekend
We enjoyed the grounds and had a wonderful time doing the reserve wine tasting. They had such a fantastic variety from whites to reds and dessert wines as well.

This is a beautiful winery to visit with a family. The grounds are beautiful & you get some gorgeous views. Unfortunately like most things in Napa, prices have shot sky high for just entering the premises. Adults are $30 with wine tasting & kids ate $20. So as a family you are looking at $100 plus. We were a family of 4 and my brother & his family who were visiting from out of town so it was a staggering $230 for 2 hours. Yikes!

We had visited the castle in the summer & the store was open in the courtyard & there was a display of how grape seed flower is made & oil tastings. This time they were setting up a huge tent for their $350 a head Great Gasby New Years event & that blocked a lot of photo ops on the grounds. I felt it was kind of unfair to charge the same entrance prices when you don’t get to enjoy the same areas of the winery.

Anyway...all in all a pretty winery. Pricey but so is everything in the area. Welcome to the Napa Valley!
Show less

The place is this medieval castle in Napa Valley. Too crowded and you have to wait a bit to do tasting. The wines I tasted were ok but nothing out of the world. The person who attended us at the tasting was very good.

We had a nice family time tasting very good wine!

One can also see the process of doing the Wine and see the wine trees.
People are very friendly!

Recommended!

An Observation is that Castle itself was constructed recently, in any case, it is interesting to see how to construct a business around a theme.

Also, be aware that one can order the wine probe with fewer options and upgrade it when already in if unsure go with the less expensive option.
Show less

Really enjoyed our visit here. The tour was very intriguing and they even let us sample their latest batch that still needed to age so that we could taste the difference. My major recommendation.. get the reserved Cabernet it was the best Cab I had in Napa
Show less
Beautiful ground, excellent wines but hard sell by server!

We visited this beautiful winery during winter and were impressed by the castle grounds.

Entry is not cheap at all though tasting in included in the price. We had paid 40 dollars each ( a handsome sum we feel) for the Reserve tasting and were thoroughly impressed by the wines.

However, one thing I did not like was the fact the server at my tasting keeps mentioning that my countrymen “always buys and ships crates of wines” back to my country.

Don’t get me wrong, I love wine and drink occasionally, and frankly the wines were excellent as well,but I am not interested in buying and shipping a crate of 12 wines back to my country! The most I usually buy on trips to vineyards is 4-5 bottles of good quality wines back to my hometown to enjoy with family and friends on special occasions.

However, the server was surprisingly persistent that my countrymen buys crates of wines back and seems disappointed when I “only” bought 4 bottles of wines (which still costed me an extra 200+ USD on top of the tasting fee). The attitude of the server kinda spoiled the experience for the whole visit and I may reconsider revisiting again if faced with such a server again.
Show less

I loved the castle so much! It is so beautiful! The tour was very nice and we had such a great time there, despite the rainy day. The only thing missing is a restaurant! That is why this is not a 5 star.
Great place to start Wine Tasting & Family Friendly

Fantastic experience! This was our first experience wine tasting. We participated in the tour and tasting. Our daughter (6 years old) was enthralled with the castle and the enchanting thoughts of kings and queens. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and made the tour fun. The wine is amazing - I highly recommend the chocolate parings with the wine.

Paulo Marcellino and the team at the bar is an amazing host and team! Do find him and he will bring you the amazing world of fine wines produced in Castello di Amorosa. I am an avid red wine drinker and red wines at Castello di Amorosa has blown me away, together with the friendliness and great knowledge from Paulo! The Castle also takes you back to medieval times - great architecture, history and superb wines! It is definitely must a visit when in Napa Valley. Thanks Paulo and Castello di Amorosa. Also get the Passport when in Napa Valley - great value!

Prices were very high but gorgeous location

We went with a underage companion as it was a family trip, and her price was 25 dollars which we thought was fine because she would get to experience what we were with juice. She received one tiny cup of juice and was told that she couldn't be with us while we were served. She ended wandering the gift shop on her own for about an hour. Now to the positive. The location itself is beautiful. We loved exploring with castle and the grounds outside. The animals are delightful. Our wine server was really friendly and didn't try to push us into making purchases which we hate. We ended up making purchases of wines that we loved without feeling like we were forced to. Overall, a pretty nice experience.

Great tour and tasting-must not miss!
A pleasant guide, fast tour and lovely/cozy/classic wine tasting and related products. Recommended for every one. The tour is reasonable priced.

A Memorable Trip to the Picturusque Napa Valley!

Visited Napa Valley and did a conducted tour with Premier wine tasting.

Surprised to know that the old Castle is only 10 years old. Understand the raw materials came from all over Europe and assembled in Napa Valley at a cost of $30 million. The Tucson castle was constructed in Roman architecture over a 30-year labour of Love! Before hearing that from the Tour Guide, I presumed the castle to be 150 to 200 years old!

The cellars & Winery are in the basement along with other rooms like a church, torture room and storage area.

After a half an hour tour, they started with not so old wine for tasting. After that, they served 5 X 2 different wines (red/ white/ sweet) for every two participants.

One can also order/ purchase or taste different wines from their bar.

An interesting trip - thanks also to our guide - Christopher!
Show less

Our fear is it would be one of those cheesy tourist traps but turned out to be quite a fun sophisticated experience with guide Thomas at the helm. We had our 8 yr old son with us and special kudos to Thomas to have gracefully accommodated and made him a part of the experience. The wines offered for tasting were top notch with IL Passito being the star.

I've been to countless wineries throughout the world, but this winery was by far the most family-friendly. We got there pretty early on a Saturday morning and the parking lot was practically full! We began walking toward the castle and we stopped after seeing the animals in the front yard! It was a great touch and kids (and adults) flocked to it. Our sommelier (Anna G.) was really knowledgable, polite and patient with us. We just did the basic wine tasting, but I noticed kids could try the non-alcoholic grape juice tasting and color as well! Overall, I'd say this is a must see while in Calistoga.

Wonderful way to spend a few hours exploring this beautiful winery in a Tuscan setting and beautiful castle! Wine is excellent and so is the staff!
Always a pleasure to go to Castello di Amorosa even got the wine club this time i Will be heading there more often

The architecture of the castle should not be missed. Truly impressive building. Booked this tour for the benefit of my 5 year old granddaughter. But the whole family really enjoyed the tasting. I had no expectations of the quality of the wines and I was very pleasantly surprised. I recommend that you reserve a private tasting.

This was a great trip! We went in off season when the grapes had already been picked, but it was a beautiful tour of the castle and it was a little chilly, but they did an outstanding job with the tour. Our tour guide Thomas was excellent. Very personable and he made the tour interactive and fun. During our wine tasting experience, he was able to pick out wines that we thoroughly enjoyed. We ended up buying 12 bottles of wine and 2 bottles of grape juice. It was delicious!
Show less
The castle is very interesting and the wine tasting in the members only room was delicious and memorable.
Incredible atmosphere and knowledgeable fun staff. The wine and cheese pairing is enough for an entire meal! Can't wait to come back!

This is a must see attraction when visiting the Napa valley. The history and charm capture one's attention. While we didn't do the guided tour, my thought is that one can see far more of the castle with the tour.

I been coming here since 2012. I love their wine and their staffs are mostly very friendly and sweet. They have an awesome dungeon, but you need to do the tour to see it. It is worth it though. Just do it once at least. I did it multiple times :D

Did I mention that their castle is very beautiful!!
Family, friends, visiting, couples. This place is for all that!

My third time here and it never disappoints. Very friendly staffs and great selections of reserved wines!

Got the chance to visit this 13th century old Tuscan castle with acres of vineyards surrounding it..the entrance to the castle will lead you to a small patio with a small chapel surrounded by pottery of spring flowers...the place would really bring you the feels of the medieval time of kings and knights. The wine tasting was held at the basement of the castle where they also showcase a winery and other products to sell. Our package includes wine with chocolate pairing...after 5 different variants, me and my friends were on cloud nine!

We had a great time touring the castle and winery and tasting the wines. Our guide, Tomasso, was outstanding. We really enjoyed their Sangiovese and the Il Barone.

The wine was excellent and the service was one of the best that I have had. the Castle was breath taking, the tour was very detailed and our tour guide was nice, friendly, approachable and sweet. He was ready to help and answer any questions that we had.

Beautiful look like castle building with wine tour and tasting. Pricey tough... surroundings have a amazing view.

I have been to this place on 17th December. The most authentic wines to taste. They don't sell outside in the market. One can buy from this place only. The guide explain the process and show the Barrel room in very interesting way. I have been to breweries but first time at wineries. Amazing Place !!!!

One of the better tours of wineries in the Napa. It's best you book as tours fill very quickly. Great history of how/when it was built.
Then off to,the obligatory tastings which was one of the better tour conclusions we had had.

Fantastic large tasting room and souvenir shop.

Definetly visit on your way to Napa.

The tour and the tasting was so very much fun! We had a really great fun filled visit. I recommend it to everyone if you will be in the area.

I was on a trip with my son to the Napa Valley, and after the traditional trolley tour, on the next day we decided to visit a couple vineyards on our own. My son was interested in the Castle, so we went there. Just buying a ticket for the tour of the Castle (we had enough wine tasting after the first day), we were in the large room where tasting and food and wine tours were given and were approached by one of the staff, John. He asked if we wanted to taste some of the wine despite not having a ticket for that. We were so impressed with John that before you knew it, in a wonderful way, we had a great hour or so and purchased a case of wine. It was a very good experience for both of us and we truly enjoyed the entire event. We never felt pressured to buy wine. It was the highlight of our Napa Valley trip. Next to a Redwood forest was also a special treat.

Girls Weekend to support Wine Country. Brought my friends who were first timers to the winery. They loved it. We did a self guided tour. We did a tasting which was our favorite part. We split a dozen bottle purchase and I became an member! Great gift shop too!

Visiting the Castle was so much fun that I've returned three times! With three different groups of family and friends. Please don't miss it!

Visited in early December for the guided tour with wine and cheese pairing. Jade was our tour guide, and provided a fun and interesting tour. The winery is worth a visit for just the magnitude and scale of the building(s). The cheeses were very good and the portion was generous. Walked out with 2 cases of wine.

A wonderful place! We feel like we’ve been to Italy for the afternoon when we visit this incredibly authentic castello. The wine is excellent.
This place is Such a unique winery tour. It was very interesting and so much fun. I HIGHLY recommend it!!

Two friends and I wanted to visit the gift shop (without tasting or touring) and discovered they would let only one person in at a time. The shop wasn't crowded, so can't imagine why. Don't need our money?? We opted to spend elsewhere!
A bit kitschy but a super fun place to visit with excellent wine to go with it

What a fun place to visit! Yes, it’s touristy and designed to separate you from your $, but the wine is excellent (the reserve wines plus Il Rubino). The tours are fun and give you a feeling of visiting a castle in Tuscany. Splurge for the reserve tasting tour, but pass on the chocolates. They’re nice, but not why you’re there. Plan on spending two hours there despite what they say. The tasting is always longer than advertised. A great way to spend a morning, especially during the week when there are less tourists. Cheers!

A trip that should be made if you are in the area

I would strongly recommend a trip to see the castle.

While it is a “new” castle, it still looks impressive and the tour was great with the guide sharing many different stories.

We had chances for many photo moments in the castle with the great doors and cellars where the wine are kept.

Do try the tasting with the wine thief too.

We’re not big wine connoisseurs but the castle was very interesting to walk around and see. I thought the price was good for the tour which included the torture chamber and other places which are off access unless doing a tour. We did have samples of about 10-12 different wines and they were all good. Highly recommended place to visit.

Second Visit, Better than the First

On our first visit we enjoyed the food-pairing tour with head sommalier Mary. This trip, now as members of the Amici de Baron Club, we took a regular tour guided by an enthusiastic and knowledgeable "career wine business" guide, Henry. Detailed explanations, touching on the wine production and the history and purpose of the castle, followed by a generous tasting experience. We are very experienced wine enthusiasts, hard to fool and please. But Sattui and his people have created a genuine and authentic experience that we will revisit over and over. (My personal history with Napa dates back to meeting Robert Mondavi in the construction trailer as they began to build Robert Mondavi Winery in 1966.)

Bad wine, but great castle tour and experience

I would go here again to tour this beautiful castle and drink their dessert wine 'La Fantasia', but not to drink their other wines. Here are all the pros, and one con, from the experience.

Pros
- Beautiful and authentic Italian castle with an impressive interior and exterior.
- The tour is fun and is full of lessons on Italian medieval history and architecture.
- The place is rich with photo opportunities.
- The first wine you taste will be taken direct from a barrel using a wine thieves device.
- The dessert wine called La Fantasia is tasty and popular.
- Their gift shop is full of cool items to purchase. We bought a set of their infused olive oils, a wine bag, a bottle opener and an empty wine barrel.
- They have some goats and chickens at the front of the castle.
- They host parties here, including a popular halloween one, that are suppose to be excellent. They have the perfect venue!

Cons
- Their wines, with the exception of La Fantasia, taste pretty bad and are harsh on the palette. No one in our group finished their wines. This estate has stayed true to old methods of wine production so this could possibly be the reason for the harsh taste. Perhaps you just need to grow accustomed to their style of wine.

I booked a group wine tasting for 15 people. I booked an upgraded "Reserve" wine tasting directly with Castello, which was supposed to include 3 of their reserve wines. This was paid for in advance. We received no reserve wines. I inquired at the time of the tasting, and they said that there was nothing that they could do and that I would have to contact the Castello's agent Angie who booked our group.

I emailed Angie with no response for 2 weeks. She eventually responded and I provided the wine sheet with the wines that we were served that showed that no reserve wines were given. It has been another 2 weeks with no response.

I have only asked that they refund the difference between the regular wine tasting and the reserve tasting ($10/person); but I cannot even get a reply from them.

Be careful that you are not cheated too!

I typically don’t write reviews but I felt inclined to for this reason. Three girlfriends and I came here over the weekend. The place is beautiful, the wine was fantastic. My girls and I were willing to buy three bottles each. However, I was VERY disappointed in the service at the wine tasting portion. The man providing us with the wine tasting, Paolo, was incredibly rude to us, especially when two of the winery club members arrived. We were trying to ask him questions about the wine but he was so focused and passionate on educating the club members, he kept brushing us away. After a while he didn’t even bother. I get it, the money makers come in and you want to keep them impressed, but for the future, don’t ignore other customers. We all wanted to love the place, but we were all shocked at the service. None of us will be going there again.

Lots of decadent rich red wines that are exclusive to this fully functional stone castle complete with underground cellars and actual watchtower? Yes. I'm in.
This is the PLACE to go in Napa

Went on a tour of 3 wineries. I quite enjoyed this one - could have avoided the other two. Guided tour was great, scenery excellent - so impressed with how much was put into building this castle. Would highly recommend this spot to other friends. Got tipsy as well and spent a lot of $ on wine - great tasting wine though.

Experience the tour and the wine pairing

It's hard to pick which place to go to in Napa but the castle is really fun. We did the tour and the wine tasting with the meal. Mary was our tour guide and she is absolutely fabulous. The castle has a great story behind it and the wine is amazing. They don't distribute their wine so make sure you take your opportunity to buy some while you are there.

This a fun tour and tasting experience especially if you have a fun tour guide. It’s a tad pricey but worth doing at least once. The wines are ok and there are lots of choices and they are reasonably priced.
Vincenzo was very helpful in describing the various blends and single vintage grapes used in their wines

beautiful and smart structure for many reasons to stand out of many fine wineries in California. it being so far below ground to reserve their wine, any fire would not affect. definitely paid tour was worth all the dimes every time i visit.. whispering wall was very charming experience as the winery forged ancient castle in very details..

as they only distribute thru membership, make it more unique..

The customer service as well as the castle itself is amazing. Wonderful experience. Look forward to returning.

We enjoyed our visit and loved the castle. The only thing that needs to be addressed are all the flying nats in the tasting area after the guided tour. They were flying in our wine glasses. I’m sure you can fix it asap. Thanks.

One of the best experiences I have ever had at a wine tasting. The castle is amazing, the wines are delicious and our wine host, Jason, created a memorable and fun experience. This should be at the top of your list for visiting.

Went to Castello di Amorosa on a Saturday in early November with my wife and adult daughter. We got there ~11am because this place (like many others in Napa valley) can get really crowed in the afternooons. Be aware that even non-drinkers need to pay the full fee to go inside the Castle, that's kind of a rip off in my opinion. Paying $30 for my wife (designated driver) to get into the castle and watch me and my daughter drink seems a little crazy. But...
The Castle is really cool. One thing to keep in mind after you get entry into the castle, explore the Castle before you taste and buy your wines. From some areas of the Castle you can get a fantastic view of the Northern Napa Valley; in general just exploring all the nooks and crannies of the Castle is a lot of fun. After you've done that and are ready for your wine tastings, try to find one of the side tasting rooms that's not too crowded. Most of the wines are very good (but not great, and some are very pricey) and they are only available at the Castle. I thought the Merlot was the best, but my daughter loves the Fantasia (to sweet for me). Between exploring the castle, shopping for trinkets (Soaps, bottle stoppers, dried pasta's, etc.), and the wine tasting, plan to spend at least 2 hours. It's almost directly across the street from Sterling Vineyards where you take a tram up to the elevated Sterling Winery, Sterling is another must stop if you never been to Napa.

I've been traveling to Napa Valley for over 40 years and have visited countless wineries in Napa/Sonoma. When a friend from Canada suggested Castello di Amorosa, I was a bit skeptical. It is relatively new (10 years old), and I expected a Disneyland/Epcot experience. I was quite surprised.

A group of 11 of us did the guided tour, including my 97-year-old father who lives in Sonoma Valley. He's visited six times more wineries than I have, and it takes a lot to impress him. At the end of the experience, he turned to me in the car and said, "Now that was awesome!"

That pretty well sums it up! Yes, it was awesome. It was not gimmicky, nor was it overplayed. The physical grounds are very beautiful without appearing like a Hollywood set.

But the real gem in the tour was our guide, Gary S. He was very humorous, quick-witted and knowledgable. The guided tour private wine tasting was not the typical "three pours and you're outta there" and well worth the slightly higher admission price.

Castello di Amorosa will now be my new recommendation to friends for a worthwhile winery tour when they're in the Napa/Sonoma area.

We chose this winery over the others as the setting looked very appealing and had heard very good things. It was around 25/30 mins from Napa centre. Free parking and easy to find.

We had booked ahead over the phone which made it quicker but you can walk in too. We booked in to a guided tour and tasting which was $40 each - this included a guided tour around the castle ( and the history behind it ) as well as a tour of the wine cellars and a walk through of the process to make their wines.

Our tour guide was fantastic ( Steve K ) and the tour , which was around 2 hours , flew by! It was a very interesting tour, well
paced , good fun and people were very happy and comfortable to ask questions.

Steve was very knowledgeable and really made our visit.

We then went to the tasting room - we had 5 wines each ( 2 of us ) but following recommendation tried 10 different wines rather than the same ones. Mixture of white , red and dessert wines. We then got to know a bit about the wine and score it.
There was then an opportunity to buy the wines and visit the shop.
Would highly recommend!

A day in Tuscany without leaving the US

We arrived here by a "Limo Bus" from the Wine Train that delivered us to the front gate.

After disembarking from the train we were assigned a tour guide that stayed with us until we arrived back at the train station. He gave us a introduction to what we would do and see at Castello Di Amorosa. He also told us that we would be getting another guide when we reached the Castle that would guide us on our tour of the Castle. The whole experience would culminate in a wine tasting at the bottom of the Castle where we would taste 6 different wines.

Usually, I'm very descriptive in my reviews but I went knowing very little other than it was a castle that was brought over from Tuscany and the wines produced here were unparalleled. I'm not going to say anything else other than this because I think it would destroy the overall experience. I will say that our guide was very knowledgeable, we experienced more than 6 wines in our tasting, for an additional $10 I experienced 3 wines that were more than $100 per bottle, I departed with the purchase of a case of wine that was shipped to my door and was held for shipment so that it arrived 2 days after I returned home.

If you should be in the Napa area and do not go to this Winery you will have missed the experience of a lifetime.
